params.text:
What result will be printed during the fourth iteration?

vec <- 1:5
for (i in vec) {
  cat(i * 2,"\n")
}

Note, that "\n" is used to introduce line breaks and will not be printed.

params.text:
What result will be printed during the fourth iteration?

for (fruit in fruits) {

}

params.text:
What result will be printed during the second iteration?

matrix1 <- matrix(1:4, nrow = 2)
matrix2 <- matrix(rep(2,4), nrow = 2)
matrix3 <- matrix(4:1, nrow = 2)

matrix_list <- list(matrix1, matrix2, matrix3)

for (mat in matrix_list) {
  cat(mat[2,2], "\n")
}

Note, that "\n" is used to introduce line breaks and will not be printed.

params.text:
What result will be printed during the third iteration?
df <- data.frame(
  Name = c("Alice", "Bob", "Charlie", "David"),
)

vec <- c(22,21,24,19)

for (i in 1:nrow(df)) {
  cat(paste(df[i, "Name"], "is", vec[i], "years old.\n"))
}

Note, that "\n" is used to introduce line breaks and will not be printed.

params.text:
What will be printed during the second iteration if matrix_data looks like this:

     [,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]

[1,]  0 |  2 |  3 | 4

[2,]  2 |  2 |  3 |  4

[3,]  3 |  3 |  4 | 0


for (i in 1:nrow(matrix_data)) {
  cat("Row", i, "Sum:", sum(matrix_data[i, ]), "\n")
}

Note, that "\n" is used to introduce line breaks and will not be printed.

params.question:
Which statements are true, given the code


numbers <- c(2, 4, 6, 8, 10)

vec0 <- c()
vec1 <- c()
vec2 <- c()
vec3 <- c()

for (i in 1:length(numbers)) {
  vec0[i] <- numbers[i]
  vec1[i] <- numbers[i]^2
  vec2[i] <- i
  vec3[i+1] <- numbers[i]-1
}
